strategy: Combine Bloom filter pre-filtering with early aggregation on fact table, restructure joins to prioritize most selective dimensions first, and exploit known data distributions. Instead of materializing
what_failed: Regression (0.41x): Restructured the query into a staged reduction pipeline. First created filtered dimension CTEs for date, customer demographics, and promotion. Then used EXISTS subqueries to prune catalog_sales rows early while preserving semi-join short-circuiting. Aggregated at the item level before the final join with item dimension, reducing the data volume for the final join. This transforms the 5-way join into a progressive filtering and aggregation pipeline.
why_it_failed: Pre-filtered and joined store_sales to date CTE BEFORE the 3-way fact table join (store_sales <- store_returns <- catalog_sales). By materializing the date-filtered store_sales early, the optimizer loses the ability to push filters across the multi-way fact join and reorder joins optimally.
